get_available_barcode_masks()[source]

Hook for extension. This function returns the available QR-code masks, in the form of a list of (code, mask_function) elements, where code is a string identifying the mask uniquely, and mask_function is a function returning a reportlab Drawing object with the result of the mask, and taking as parameters:

  • width of the QR-code, in pixels

  • height of the QR-code, in pixels

  • reportlab Drawing object containing the barcode to apply the mask on

get_paperformat()[source]
get_wkhtmltopdf_state()[source]

Get the current state of wkhtmltopdf: install, ok, upgrade, workers or broken. * install: Starting state. * upgrade: The binary is an older version (< 0.12.0). * ok: A binary was found with a recent version (>= 0.12.0). * workers: Not enough workers found to perform the pdf rendering process (< 2 workers). * broken: A binary was found but not responding.

Returns:

wkhtmltopdf_state

groups_id

Many2many field; the value of such a field is the recordset.

Parameters:

  • comodel_name – name of the target model (string) mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields

  • relation (str) – optional name of the table that stores the relation in the database

  • column1 (str) – optional name of the column referring to “these” records in the table relation

  • column2 (str) – optional name of the column referring to “those” records in the table relation

The attributes relation, column1 and column2 are optional. If not given, names are automatically generated from model names, provided model_name and comodel_name are different!

Note that having several fields with implicit relation parameters on a given model with the same comodel is not accepted by the ORM, since those field would use the same table. The ORM prevents two many2many fields to use the same relation parameters, except if

  • both fields use the same model, comodel, and relation parameters are explicit; or

  • at least one field belongs to a model with _auto = False.

Parameters:

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

id

Special case for field ‘id’.

model

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

model_id

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

multi

Encapsulates a bool.

paperformat_id

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

report_name

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

report_type

Encapsulates an exclusive choice between different values.

Parameters:

  • selection (list(tuple(str,str)) or callable or str) – specifies the possible values for this field. It is given as either a list of pairs (value, label), or a model method, or a method name.

  • selection_add (list(tuple(str,str))) –

    provides an extension of the selection in the case of an overridden field. It is a list of pairs (value, label) or singletons (value,), where singleton values must appear in the overridden selection. The new values are inserted in an order that is consistent with the overridden selection and this list:

    selection = [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B')]
selection_add = [('c', 'C'), ('b',)]
> result = [('a', 'A'), ('c', 'C'), ('b', 'B')]

  • ondelete –

    provides a fallback mechanism for any overridden field with a selection_add. It is a dict that maps every option from the selection_add to a fallback action.

    This fallback action will be applied to all records whose selection_add option maps to it.

    The actions can be any of the following:

    • ’set null’ – the default, all records with this option will have their selection value set to False.

    • ’cascade’ – all records with this option will be deleted along with the option itself.

    • ’set default’ – all records with this option will be set to the default of the field definition

    • ’set VALUE’ – all records with this option will be set to the given value

    • <callable> – a callable whose first and only argument will be the set of records containing the specified Selection option, for custom processing

The attribute selection is mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields.

retrieve_attachment(record)[source]

Retrieve an attachment for a specific record.

Parameters:

record – The record owning of the attachment.

Returns:

A recordset of length <=1 or None

type

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

odoo.addons.base.models.ir_asset module

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_asset.AssetPaths[source]

Bases: object

A list of asset paths (path, addon, bundle) with efficient operations.

append(paths, bundle)[source]

Appends the given paths to the current list.

index(path, bundle)[source]

Returns the index of the given path in the current assets list.

insert(paths, bundle, index)[source]

Inserts the given paths to the current list at the given position.

remove(paths_to_remove, bundle)[source]

Removes the given paths from the current list.

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_asset.IrAsset(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: Model

This model contributes to two things:

1. It provides a function returning a list of all file paths declared in a given list of addons (see _get_addon_paths);

2. It allows to create ‘ir.asset’ records to add additional directives to certain bundles.

active

Encapsulates a bool.

bundle

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

create(vals_list) → records[source]

Creates new records for the model.

The new records are initialized using the values from the list of dicts vals_list, and if necessary those from default_get().

Parameters:

vals_list (Union[list[dict], dict]) –

values for the model’s fields, as a list of dictionaries:

[{'field_name': field_value, ...}, ...]

For backward compatibility, vals_list may be a dictionary. It is treated as a singleton list [vals], and a single record is returned.

see write() for details

Returns:

the created records

Raises:

  • AccessError – if the current user is not allowed to create records of the specified model

  • ValidationError – if user tries to enter invalid value for a selection field

  • ValueError – if a field name specified in the create values does not exist.

  • UserError – if a loop would be created in a hierarchy of objects a result of the operation (such as setting an object as its own parent)

create_date

Encapsulates a python datetime object.

create_uid

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

directive

Encapsulates an exclusive choice between different values.

Parameters:

  • selection (list(tuple(str,str)) or callable or str) – specifies the possible values for this field. It is given as either a list of pairs (value, label), or a model method, or a method name.

  • selection_add (list(tuple(str,str))) –

    provides an extension of the selection in the case of an overridden field. It is a list of pairs (value, label) or singletons (value,), where singleton values must appear in the overridden selection. The new values are inserted in an order that is consistent with the overridden selection and this list:

    selection = [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B')]
selection_add = [('c', 'C'), ('b',)]
> result = [('a', 'A'), ('c', 'C'), ('b', 'B')]

  • ondelete –

    provides a fallback mechanism for any overridden field with a selection_add. It is a dict that maps every option from the selection_add to a fallback action.

    This fallback action will be applied to all records whose selection_add option maps to it.

    The actions can be any of the following:

    • ’set null’ – the default, all records with this option will have their selection value set to False.

    • ’cascade’ – all records with this option will be deleted along with the option itself.

    • ’set default’ – all records with this option will be set to the default of the field definition

    • ’set VALUE’ – all records with this option will be set to the given value

    • <callable> – a callable whose first and only argument will be the set of records containing the specified Selection option, for custom processing

The attribute selection is mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields.

unlink()[source]

Deletes the records in self.

Raises:

  • AccessError – if the user is not allowed to delete all the given records

  • UserError – if the record is default property for other records

write(vals)[source]

Updates all records in self with the provided values.

Parameters:

vals (dict) – fields to update and the value to set on them

Raises:

  • AccessError – if user is not allowed to modify the specified records/fields

  • ValidationError – if invalid values are specified for selection fields

  • UserError – if a loop would be created in a hierarchy of objects a result of the operation (such as setting an object as its own parent)

  • For numeric fields (Integer, Float) the value should be of the corresponding type

  • For Boolean, the value should be a python:bool

  • For Selection, the value should match the selection values (generally python:str, sometimes python:int)

  • For Many2one, the value should be the database identifier of the record to set

  • The expected value of a One2many or Many2many relational field is a list of Command that manipulate the relation the implement. There are a total of 7 commands: create(), update(), delete(), unlink(), link(), clear(), and set().

  • For Date and ~odoo.fields.Datetime, the value should be either a date(time), or a string.

    Warning

    If a string is provided for Date(time) fields, it must be UTC-only and formatted according to odoo.tools.misc.DEFAULT_SERVER_DATE_FORMAT and odoo.tools.misc.DEFAULT_SERVER_DATETIME_FORMAT

  • Other non-relational fields use a string for value

write_date

Encapsulates a python datetime object.

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

odoo.addons.base.models.ir_asset.is_wildcard_glob(path)[source]

Determine whether a path is a wildcarded glob eg: “/web/file[14].*” or a genuine single file path “/web/myfile.scss

odoo.addons.base.models.ir_attachment module

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_attachment.IrAttachment(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: Model

Attachments are used to link binary files or url to any openerp document.

External attachment storage

The computed field datas is implemented using _file_read, _file_write and _file_delete, which can be overridden to implement other storage engines. Such methods should check for other location pseudo uri (example: hdfs://hadoopserver).

The default implementation is the file:dirname location that stores files on the local filesystem using name based on their sha1 hash

access_token

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

get_serving_groups()[source]

An ir.attachment record may be used as a fallback in the http dispatch if its type field is set to “binary” and its url field is set as the request’s url. Only the groups returned by this method are allowed to create and write on such records.

Special case for field ‘id’.

res_field

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

res_id

Pseudo-relational field (no FK in database).

The field value is stored as an integer id in database.

Contrary to Reference fields, the model has to be specified in a Char field, whose name has to be specified in the model_field attribute for the current Many2oneReference field.

Parameters:

model_field (str) – name of the Char where the model name is stored.

type

Encapsulates an exclusive choice between different values.

Parameters:

  • selection (list(tuple(str,str)) or callable or str) – specifies the possible values for this field. It is given as either a list of pairs (value, label), or a model method, or a method name.

  • selection_add (list(tuple(str,str))) –

    provides an extension of the selection in the case of an overridden field. It is a list of pairs (value, label) or singletons (value,), where singleton values must appear in the overridden selection. The new values are inserted in an order that is consistent with the overridden selection and this list:

    selection = [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B')]
selection_add = [('c', 'C'), ('b',)]
> result = [('a', 'A'), ('c', 'C'), ('b', 'B')]

  • ondelete –

    provides a fallback mechanism for any overridden field with a selection_add. It is a dict that maps every option from the selection_add to a fallback action.

    This fallback action will be applied to all records whose selection_add option maps to it.

    The actions can be any of the following:

    • ’set null’ – the default, all records with this option will have their selection value set to False.

    • ’cascade’ – all records with this option will be deleted along with the option itself.

    • ’set default’ – all records with this option will be set to the default of the field definition

    • ’set VALUE’ – all records with this option will be set to the given value

    • <callable> – a callable whose first and only argument will be the set of records containing the specified Selection option, for custom processing

The attribute selection is mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields.

unlink()[source]

Deletes the records in self.

Raises:

  • AccessError – if the user is not allowed to delete all the given records

  • UserError – if the record is default property for other records

url

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

validate_access(access_token)[source]
write(vals)[source]

Updates all records in self with the provided values.

Parameters:

vals (dict) – fields to update and the value to set on them

Raises:

  • AccessError – if user is not allowed to modify the specified records/fields

  • ValidationError – if invalid values are specified for selection fields

  • UserError – if a loop would be created in a hierarchy of objects a result of the operation (such as setting an object as its own parent)

  • For numeric fields (Integer, Float) the value should be of the corresponding type

  • For Boolean, the value should be a python:bool

  • For Selection, the value should match the selection values (generally python:str, sometimes python:int)

  • For Many2one, the value should be the database identifier of the record to set

  • The expected value of a One2many or Many2many relational field is a list of Command that manipulate the relation the implement. There are a total of 7 commands: create(), update(), delete(), unlink(), link(), clear(), and set().

  • For Date and ~odoo.fields.Datetime, the value should be either a date(time), or a string.

    Warning

    If a string is provided for Date(time) fields, it must be UTC-only and formatted according to odoo.tools.misc.DEFAULT_SERVER_DATE_FORMAT and odoo.tools.misc.DEFAULT_SERVER_DATETIME_FORMAT

  • Other non-relational fields use a string for value

write_date

Encapsulates a python datetime object.

write_uid

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_autovacuum.AutoVacuum(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Return whether func is an autovacuum method.

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_binary.IrBinary(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

odoo.addons.base.models.ir_config_parameter module

Store database-specific configuration parameters

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_config_parameter.IrConfigParameter(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: Model

Per-database storage of configuration key-value pairs.

create(vals_list) → records[source]

Creates new records for the model.

The new records are initialized using the values from the list of dicts vals_list, and if necessary those from default_get().

Parameters:

vals_list (Union[list[dict], dict]) –

values for the model’s fields, as a list of dictionaries:

[{'field_name': field_value, ...}, ...]

For backward compatibility, vals_list may be a dictionary. It is treated as a singleton list [vals], and a single record is returned.

see write() for details

Returns:

the created records

Raises:

  • AccessError – if the current user is not allowed to create records of the specified model

  • ValidationError – if user tries to enter invalid value for a selection field

  • ValueError – if a field name specified in the create values does not exist.

  • UserError – if a loop would be created in a hierarchy of objects a result of the operation (such as setting an object as its own parent)

create_date

Encapsulates a python datetime object.

create_uid

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

display_name

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

get_param(key, default=False)[source]

Retrieve the value for a given key.

Parameters:

  • key (string) – The key of the parameter value to retrieve.

  • default (string) – default value if parameter is missing.

Returns:

The value of the parameter, or default if it does not exist.

Return type:

string

id

Special case for field ‘id’.

init(force=False)[source]

Initializes the parameters listed in _default_parameters. It overrides existing parameters if force is True.

key

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

set_param(key, value)[source]

Sets the value of a parameter.

Parameters:

  • key (string) – The key of the parameter value to set.

  • value (string) – The value to set.

Returns:

the previous value of the parameter or False if it did not exist.

Return type:

string

Parameters:

translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

default_get(fields_list) → default_values[source]

Return default values for the fields in fields_list. Default values are determined by the context, user defaults, and the model itself.

Parameters:

fields_list (list) – names of field whose default is requested

Returns:

a dictionary mapping field names to their corresponding default values, if they have a default value.

Return type:

dict

Note

Unrequested defaults won’t be considered, there is no need to return a value for fields whose names are not in fields_list.

display_name

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

doall

Encapsulates a bool.

id

Special case for field ‘id’.

interval_number

Encapsulates an int.

interval_type

Encapsulates an exclusive choice between different values.

Parameters:

  • selection (list(tuple(str,str)) or callable or str) – specifies the possible values for this field. It is given as either a list of pairs (value, label), or a model method, or a method name.

  • selection_add (list(tuple(str,str))) –

    provides an extension of the selection in the case of an overridden field. It is a list of pairs (value, label) or singletons (value,), where singleton values must appear in the overridden selection. The new values are inserted in an order that is consistent with the overridden selection and this list:

    selection = [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B')]
selection_add = [('c', 'C'), ('b',)]
> result = [('a', 'A'), ('c', 'C'), ('b', 'B')]

  • ondelete –

    provides a fallback mechanism for any overridden field with a selection_add. It is a dict that maps every option from the selection_add to a fallback action.

    This fallback action will be applied to all records whose selection_add option maps to it.

    The actions can be any of the following:

    • ’set null’ – the default, all records with this option will have their selection value set to False.

    • ’cascade’ – all records with this option will be deleted along with the option itself.

    • ’set default’ – all records with this option will be set to the default of the field definition

    • ’set VALUE’ – all records with this option will be set to the given value

    • <callable> – a callable whose first and only argument will be the set of records containing the specified Selection option, for custom processing

The attribute selection is mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields.

ir_actions_server_id

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

Creates new records for the model.

create_date

create_uid

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

discard_records(records)[source]

Discard all the defaults of many2one fields using any of the given records.

discard_values(model_name, field_name, values)[source]

Discard all the defaults for any of the given values.

display_name

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

field_id

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

id

Special case for field ‘id’.

json_value

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

set(model_name, field_name, value, user_id=False, company_id=False, condition=False)[source]

Defines a default value for the given field. Any entry for the same scope (field, user, company) will be replaced. The value is encoded in JSON to be stored to the database.

Parameters:

  • model_name

  • field_name

  • value

  • user_id – may be False for all users, True for the current user, or any user id

  • company_id – may be False for all companies, True for the current user’s company, or any company id

  • condition – optional condition that restricts the applicability of the default value; this is an opaque string, but the client typically uses single-field conditions in the form 'key=val'.

unlink()[source]

Deletes the records in self.

Raises:

  • AccessError – if the user is not allowed to delete all the given records

  • UserError – if the record is default property for other records

user_id

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

write(vals)[source]

Updates all records in self with the provided values.

Parameters:

vals (dict) – fields to update and the value to set on them

Raises:

  • AccessError – if user is not allowed to modify the specified records/fields

  • ValidationError – if invalid values are specified for selection fields

  • UserError – if a loop would be created in a hierarchy of objects a result of the operation (such as setting an object as its own parent)

  • For numeric fields (Integer, Float) the value should be of the corresponding type

  • For Boolean, the value should be a python:bool

  • For Selection, the value should match the selection values (generally python:str, sometimes python:int)

  • For Many2one, the value should be the database identifier of the record to set

  • The expected value of a One2many or Many2many relational field is a list of Command that manipulate the relation the implement. There are a total of 7 commands: create(), update(), delete(), unlink(), link(), clear(), and set().

  • For Date and ~odoo.fields.Datetime, the value should be either a date(time), or a string.

    Warning

    If a string is provided for Date(time) fields, it must be UTC-only and formatted according to odoo.tools.misc.DEFAULT_SERVER_DATE_FORMAT and odoo.tools.misc.DEFAULT_SERVER_DATETIME_FORMAT

  • Other non-relational fields use a string for value

write_date

Encapsulates a python datetime object.

write_uid

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

failure_ids

One2many field; the value of such a field is the recordset of all the records in comodel_name such that the field inverse_name is equal to the current record.

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model

  • inverse_name (str) – name of the inverse Many2one field in comodel_name

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

The attributes comodel_name and inverse_name are mandatory except in the case of related fields or field extensions.

odoo.addons.base.models.ir_fields module

exception odoo.addons.base.models.ir_fields.ConversionNotFound[source]

Bases: ValueError

exception odoo.addons.base.models.ir_fields.ImportWarning[source]

Bases: Warning

Used to send warnings upwards the stack during the import process

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_fields.IrFieldsConverter(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

db_id_for(model, field, subfield, value)[source]

Finds a database id for the reference value in the referencing subfield subfield of the provided field of the provided model.

Parameters:

  • model – model to which the field belongs

  • field – relational field for which references are provided

  • subfield – a relational subfield allowing building of refs to existing records: None for a name_search, id for an external id and .id for a database id

  • value – value of the reference to match to an actual record

Returns:

a pair of the matched database identifier (if any), the translated user-readable name for the field and the list of warnings

Return type:

(ID|None, unicode, list)

for_model(model, fromtype=<class 'str'>)[source]

Returns a converter object for the model. A converter is a callable taking a record-ish (a dictionary representing an odoo record with values of typetag fromtype) and returning a converted records matching what odoo.osv.orm.Model.write() expects.

Parameters:

  • model – odoo.osv.orm.Model for the conversion base

  • fromtype

Returns:

a converter callable

Return type:

(record: dict, logger: (field, error) -> None) -> dict

to_field(model, field, fromtype=<class 'str'>)[source]

Fetches a converter for the provided field object, from the specified type.

A converter is simply a callable taking a value of type fromtype (or a composite of fromtype, e.g. list or dict) and returning a value acceptable for a write() on the field field.

By default, tries to get a method on itself with a name matching the pattern _$fromtype_to_$field.type and returns it.

Converter callables can either return a value and a list of warnings to their caller or raise ValueError, which will be interpreted as a validation & conversion failure.

ValueError can have either one or two parameters. The first parameter is mandatory, must be a unicode string and will be used as the user-visible message for the error (it should be translatable and translated). It can contain a field named format placeholder so the caller can inject the field’s translated, user-facing name (@string).

The second parameter is optional and, if provided, must be a mapping. This mapping will be merged into the error dictionary returned to the client.

If a converter can perform its function but has to make assumptions about the data, it can send a warning to the user through adding an instance of ImportWarning to the second value it returns. The handling of a warning at the upper levels is the same as ValueError above.

Parameters:

  • model

  • field (odoo.fields.Field) – field object to generate a value for

  • fromtype (type | str) – type to convert to something fitting for field

Returns:

a function (fromtype -> field.write_type), if a converter is found

Return type:

Callable | None

odoo.addons.base.models.ir_fields.exclude_ref_fields(record)[source]
odoo.addons.base.models.ir_fields.only_ref_fields(record)[source]

odoo.addons.base.models.ir_filters module

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_filters.IrFilters(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: Model

action_id

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

active

Encapsulates a bool.

context

Very similar to Char but used for longer contents, does not have a size and usually displayed as a multiline text box.

Parameters:

translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

Duplicate record self updating it with default values

Parameters:

default (dict) – dictionary of field values to override in the original values of the copied record, e.g: {'field_name': overridden_value, ...}

Returns:

new record

get_filters(model, action_id=None)[source]

Obtain the list of filters available for the user on the given model.

Parameters:

  • model (int) – id of model to find filters for

  • action_id – optional ID of action to restrict filters to this action plus global filters. If missing only global filters are returned. The action does not have to correspond to the model, it may only be a contextual action.

Returns:

list of read()-like dicts containing the name, is_default, domain, user_id (m2o tuple), action_id (m2o tuple) and context of the matching ir.filters.

id

Special case for field ‘id’.

is_default

Encapsulates a bool.

model_id

Encapsulates an exclusive choice between different values.

Parameters:

  • selection (list(tuple(str,str)) or callable or str) – specifies the possible values for this field. It is given as either a list of pairs (value, label), or a model method, or a method name.

  • selection_add (list(tuple(str,str))) –

    provides an extension of the selection in the case of an overridden field. It is a list of pairs (value, label) or singletons (value,), where singleton values must appear in the overridden selection. The new values are inserted in an order that is consistent with the overridden selection and this list:

    selection = [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B')]
selection_add = [('c', 'C'), ('b',)]
> result = [('a', 'A'), ('c', 'C'), ('b', 'B')]

  • ondelete –

    provides a fallback mechanism for any overridden field with a selection_add. It is a dict that maps every option from the selection_add to a fallback action.

    This fallback action will be applied to all records whose selection_add option maps to it.

    The actions can be any of the following:

    • ’set null’ – the default, all records with this option will have their selection value set to False.

    • ’cascade’ – all records with this option will be deleted along with the option itself.

    • ’set default’ – all records with this option will be set to the default of the field definition

    • ’set VALUE’ – all records with this option will be set to the given value

    • <callable> – a callable whose first and only argument will be the set of records containing the specified Selection option, for custom processing

The attribute selection is mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields.

name

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

sort

Very similar to Char but used for longer contents, does not have a size and usually displayed as a multiline text box.

Parameters:

translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

Bases: Rule

_compile_builder is a major part of the routing map generation and rules are actually not build so often. This classe makes calls to _compile_builder lazy

type

Encapsulates an exclusive choice between different values.

Parameters:

    provides an extension of the selection in the case of an overridden field.     selection = [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B')]

> result = [('a', 'A'), ('c', 'C'), ('b', 'B')]

  • ondelete –

    provides a fallback mechanism for any overridden field with a selection_add. It is a dict that maps every option from the selection_add to a fallback action.

    This fallback action will be applied to all records whose selection_add option maps to it.

    The actions can be any of the following:

    • ’set null’ – the default, all records with this option will have their selection value set to False.

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_mail_server.IrMailServer(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents an SMTP server, able to send outgoing emails, with SSL and TLS capabilities.

NO_FOUND_FROM = 'You must either provide a sender address explicitly or configure using the combination of `mail.catchall.domain` and `mail.default.from` ICPs, in the server configuration file or with the --email-from startup parameter.'
NO_FOUND_SMTP_FROM = 'The Return-Path or From header is required for any outbound email'
NO_VALID_FROM = "Malformed 'Return-Path' or 'From' address. It should contain one valid plain ASCII email"
NO_VALID_RECIPIENT = 'At least one valid recipient address should be specified for outgoing emails (To/Cc/Bcc)'
active

Encapsulates a bool.

build_email(email_from, email_to, subject, body, email_cc=None, email_bcc=None, reply_to=False, attachments=None, message_id=None, references=None, object_id=False, subtype='plain', headers=None, body_alternative=None, subtype_alternative='plain')[source]

Constructs an RFC2822 email.message.Message object based on the keyword arguments passed, and returns it.

Parameters:

  • email_from (string) – sender email address

  • email_to (list) – list of recipient addresses (to be joined with commas)

  • subject (string) – email subject (no pre-encoding/quoting necessary)

  • body (string) – email body, of the type subtype (by default, plaintext). If html subtype is used, the message will be automatically converted to plaintext and wrapped in multipart/alternative, unless an explicit body_alternative version is passed.

  • body_alternative (string) – optional alternative body, of the type specified in subtype_alternative

  • reply_to (string) – optional value of Reply-To header

  • object_id (string) – optional tracking identifier, to be included in the message-id for recognizing replies. Suggested format for object-id is “res_id-model”, e.g. “12345-crm.lead”.

  • subtype (string) – optional mime subtype for the text body (usually ‘plain’ or ‘html’), must match the format of the body parameter. Default is ‘plain’, making the content part of the mail “text/plain”.

  • subtype_alternative (string) – optional mime subtype of body_alternative (usually ‘plain’ or ‘html’). Default is ‘plain’.

  • attachments (list) – list of (filename, filecontents) pairs, where filecontents is a string containing the bytes of the attachment

  • message_id

  • references

  • email_cc (list) – optional list of string values for CC header (to be joined with commas)

  • email_bcc (list) – optional list of string values for BCC header (to be joined with commas)

  • headers (dict) – optional map of headers to set on the outgoing mail (may override the other headers, including Subject, Reply-To, Message-Id, etc.)

Return type:

email.message.EmailMessage

Returns:

the new RFC2822 email message

connect(host=None, port=None, user=None, password=None, encryption=None, smtp_from=None, ssl_certificate=None, ssl_private_key=None, smtp_debug=False, mail_server_id=None, allow_archived=False)[source]

Returns a new SMTP connection to the given SMTP server. When running in test mode, this method does nothing and returns None.

Parameters:

  • host – host or IP of SMTP server to connect to, if mail_server_id not passed

  • port (int) – SMTP port to connect to

  • user – optional username to authenticate with

  • password – optional password to authenticate with

  • encryption (string) – optional, 'ssl' | 'starttls'

  • smtp_from – FROM SMTP envelop, used to find the best mail server

  • ssl_certificate – filename of the SSL certificate used for authentication Used when no mail server is given and overwrite the odoo-bin argument “smtp_ssl_certificate”

  • ssl_private_key – filename of the SSL private key used for authentication Used when no mail server is given and overwrite the odoo-bin argument “smtp_ssl_private_key”

  • smtp_debug (bool) – toggle debugging of SMTP sessions (all i/o will be output in logs)

  • mail_server_id – ID of specific mail server to use (overrides other parameters)

  • allow_archived (bool) – by default (False), an exception is raised when calling this method on an

archived record (using mail_server_id param). It can be set to True for testing so that the exception is no longer raised.

name

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

send_email(message, mail_server_id=None, smtp_server=None, smtp_port=None, smtp_user=None, smtp_password=None, smtp_encryption=None, smtp_ssl_certificate=None, smtp_ssl_private_key=None, smtp_debug=False, smtp_session=None)[source]

Sends an email directly (no queuing).

No retries are done, the caller should handle MailDeliveryException in order to ensure that the mail is never lost.

If the mail_server_id is provided, sends using this mail server, ignoring other smtp_* arguments. If mail_server_id is None and smtp_server is None, use the default mail server (highest priority). If mail_server_id is None and smtp_server is not None, use the provided smtp_* arguments. If both mail_server_id and smtp_server are None, look for an ‘smtp_server’ value in server config, and fails if not found.

Parameters:

  • message – the email.message.Message to send. The envelope sender will be extracted from the Return-Path (if present), or will be set to the default bounce address. The envelope recipients will be extracted from the combined list of To, CC and BCC headers.

  • smtp_session – optional pre-established SMTP session. When provided, overrides mail_server_id and all the smtp_* parameters. Passing the matching mail_server_id may yield better debugging/log messages. The caller is in charge of disconnecting the session.

  • mail_server_id – optional id of ir.mail_server to use for sending. overrides other smtp_* arguments.

  • smtp_server – optional hostname of SMTP server to use

  • smtp_encryption – optional TLS mode, one of ‘none’, ‘starttls’ or ‘ssl’ (see ir.mail_server fields for explanation)

  • smtp_port – optional SMTP port, if mail_server_id is not passed

  • smtp_user – optional SMTP user, if mail_server_id is not passed

  • smtp_password – optional SMTP password to use, if mail_server_id is not passed

  • smtp_ssl_certificate – filename of the SSL certificate used for authentication

  • smtp_ssl_private_key – filename of the SSL private key used for authentication

  • smtp_debug – optional SMTP debug flag, if mail_server_id is not passed

Returns:

the Message-ID of the message that was just sent, if successfully sent, otherwise raises MailDeliveryException and logs root cause.

sequence

Encapsulates an int.

smtp_authentication

Encapsulates an exclusive choice between different values.

Parameters:

  • selection (list(tuple(str,str)) or callable or str) – specifies the possible values for this field. It is given as either a list of pairs (value, label), or a model method, or a method name.

  • selection_add (list(tuple(str,str))) –

    provides an extension of the selection in the case of an overridden field. It is a list of pairs (value, label) or singletons (value,), where singleton values must appear in the overridden selection. The new values are inserted in an order that is consistent with the overridden selection and this list:

    selection = [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B')]
selection_add = [('c', 'C'), ('b',)]
> result = [('a', 'A'), ('c', 'C'), ('b', 'B')]

  • ondelete –

    provides a fallback mechanism for any overridden field with a selection_add. It is a dict that maps every option from the selection_add to a fallback action.

    This fallback action will be applied to all records whose selection_add option maps to it.

    The actions can be any of the following:

    • ’set null’ – the default, all records with this option will have their selection value set to False.

    • ’cascade’ – all records with this option will be deleted along with the option itself.

    • ’set default’ – all records with this option will be set to the default of the field definition

    • ’set VALUE’ – all records with this option will be set to the given value

    • <callable> – a callable whose first and only argument will be the set of records containing the specified Selection option, for custom processing

The attribute selection is mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields.

smtp_authentication_info

Very similar to Char but used for longer contents, does not have a size and usually displayed as a multiline text box.

Parameters:

translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

smtp_debug

Encapsulates a bool.

smtp_encryption

Encapsulates an exclusive choice between different values.

Parameters:

  • selection (list(tuple(str,str)) or callable or str) – specifies the possible values for this field. It is given as either a list of pairs (value, label), or a model method, or a method name.

  • selection_add (list(tuple(str,str))) –

    provides an extension of the selection in the case of an overridden field. It is a list of pairs (value, label) or singletons (value,), where singleton values must appear in the overridden selection. The new values are inserted in an order that is consistent with the overridden selection and this list:

    selection = [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B')]
selection_add = [('c', 'C'), ('b',)]
> result = [('a', 'A'), ('c', 'C'), ('b', 'B')]

  • ondelete –

    provides a fallback mechanism for any overridden field with a selection_add. It is a dict that maps every option from the selection_add to a fallback action.

    This fallback action will be applied to all records whose selection_add option maps to it.

    The actions can be any of the following:

    • ’set null’ – the default, all records with this option will have their selection value set to False.

    • ’cascade’ – all records with this option will be deleted along with the option itself.

    • ’set default’ – all records with this option will be set to the default of the field definition

    • ’set VALUE’ – all records with this option will be set to the given value

    • <callable> – a callable whose first and only argument will be the set of records containing the specified Selection option, for custom processing

The attribute selection is mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields.

smtp_host

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

smtp_pass

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

smtp_port

Encapsulates an int.

attachment (bool) – whether the field should be stored as ir_attachment or in a column of the model’s table (default: True).

Parameters:

attachment (bool) – whether the field should be stored as ir_attachment or in a column of the model’s table (default: True).

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

write_date

Encapsulates a python datetime object.

write_uid

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

odoo.addons.base.models.ir_mail_server.extract_rfc2822_addresses(text)[source]

odoo.addons.base.models.ir_model module

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_model.Base(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

The base model, which is implicitly inherited by all models.

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_model.IrModel(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: Model

access_ids

One2many field; the value of such a field is the recordset of all the records in comodel_name such that the field inverse_name is equal to the current record.

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model

  • inverse_name (str) – name of the inverse Many2one field in comodel_name

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

The attributes comodel_name and inverse_name are mandatory except in the case of related fields or field extensions.

count

Encapsulates an int.

create(vals_list) → records[source]

Creates new records for the model.

The new records are initialized using the values from the list of dicts vals_list, and if necessary those from default_get().

Parameters:

vals_list (Union[list[dict], dict]) –

values for the model’s fields, as a list of dictionaries:

[{'field_name': field_value, ...}, ...]

For backward compatibility, vals_list may be a dictionary. It is treated as a singleton list [vals], and a single record is returned.

see write() for details

Returns:

the created records

Raises:

  • AccessError – if the current user is not allowed to create records of the specified model

  • ValidationError – if user tries to enter invalid value for a selection field

  • ValueError – if a field name specified in the create values does not exist.

  • UserError – if a loop would be created in a hierarchy of objects a result of the operation (such as setting an object as its own parent)

create_date

Encapsulates a python datetime object.

create_uid

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

One2many field; the value of such a field is the recordset of all the records in comodel_name such that the field inverse_name is equal to the current record.

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model

  • inverse_name (str) – name of the inverse Many2one field in comodel_name

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

info

Very similar to Char but used for longer contents, does not have a size and usually displayed as a multiline text box.

Parameters:

translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

inherited_model_ids

Many2many field; the value of such a field is the recordset.

Parameters:

  • comodel_name – name of the target model (string) mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields

  • relation (str) – optional name of the table that stores the relation in the database

  • column1 (str) – optional name of the column referring to “these” records in the table relation

  • column2 (str) – optional name of the column referring to “those” records in the table relation

The attributes relation, column1 and column2 are optional. If not given, names are automatically generated from model names, provided model_name and comodel_name are different!

Note that having several fields with implicit relation parameters on a given model with the same comodel is not accepted by the ORM, since those field would use the same table. The ORM prevents two many2many fields to use the same relation parameters, except if

  • both fields use the same model, comodel, and relation parameters are explicit; or

  • at least one field belongs to a model with _auto = False.

Parameters:

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

model

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model

  • inverse_name (str) – name of the inverse Many2one field in comodel_name

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

The attributes comodel_name and inverse_name are mandatory except in the case of related fields or field extensions.

state

Encapsulates an exclusive choice between different values.

Parameters:

  • selection (list(tuple(str,str)) or callable or str) – specifies the possible values for this field. It is given as either a list of pairs (value, label), or a model method, or a method name.

  • selection_add (list(tuple(str,str))) –

    provides an extension of the selection in the case of an overridden field. It is a list of pairs (value, label) or singletons (value,), where singleton values must appear in the overridden selection. The new values are inserted in an order that is consistent with the overridden selection and this list:

    selection = [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B')]
selection_add = [('c', 'C'), ('b',)]
> result = [('a', 'A'), ('c', 'C'), ('b', 'B')]

  • ondelete –

    provides a fallback mechanism for any overridden field with a selection_add. It is a dict that maps every option from the selection_add to a fallback action.

    This fallback action will be applied to all records whose selection_add option maps to it.

    The actions can be any of the following:

    • ’set null’ – the default, all records with this option will have their selection value set to False.

    • ’cascade’ – all records with this option will be deleted along with the option itself.

    • ’set default’ – all records with this option will be set to the default of the field definition

    • ’set VALUE’ – all records with this option will be set to the given value

    • <callable> – a callable whose first and only argument will be the set of records containing the specified Selection option, for custom processing

The attribute selection is mandatory except in the case of related or extended fields.

transient

Encapsulates a bool.

unlink()[source]

Deletes the records in self.

Raises:

  • AccessError – if the user is not allowed to delete all the given records

  • UserError – if the record is default property for other records

view_ids

One2many field; the value of such a field is the recordset of all the records in comodel_name such that the field inverse_name is equal to the current record.

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model

  • inverse_name (str) – name of the inverse Many2one field in comodel_name

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

The attributes comodel_name and inverse_name are mandatory except in the case of related fields or field extensions.

write(vals)[source]

Updates all records in self with the provided values.

Parameters:

vals (dict) – fields to update and the value to set on them

Raises:

  • AccessError – if user is not allowed to modify the specified records/fields

  • ValidationError – if invalid values are specified for selection fields

  • UserError – if a loop would be created in a hierarchy of objects a result of the operation (such as setting an object as its own parent)

  • For numeric fields (Integer, Float) the value should be of the corresponding type

  • For Boolean, the value should be a python:bool

  • For Selection, the value should match the selection values (generally python:str, sometimes python:int)

  • For Many2one, the value should be the database identifier of the record to set

  • The expected value of a One2many or Many2many relational field is a list of Command that manipulate the relation the implement. There are a total of 7 commands: create(), update(), delete(), unlink(), link(), clear(), and set().

  • For Date and ~odoo.fields.Datetime, the value should be either a date(time), or a string.

    Warning

    If a string is provided for Date(time) fields, it must be UTC-only and formatted according to odoo.tools.misc.DEFAULT_SERVER_DATE_FORMAT and odoo.tools.misc.DEFAULT_SERVER_DATETIME_FORMAT

  • Other non-relational fields use a string for value

write_date

Encapsulates a python datetime object.

write_uid

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

class odoo.addons.base.models.ir_model.IrModelConstraint(env, ids, prefetch_ids)[source]

Bases: Model

This model tracks PostgreSQL foreign keys and constraints used by Odoo models.

copy(default=None)[source]

Duplicate record self updating it with default values

Parameters:

default (dict) – dictionary of field values to override in the original values of the copied record, e.g: {'field_name': overridden_value, ...}

Returns:

new record

create_date

Encapsulates a python datetime object.

create_uid

The value of such a field is a recordset of size 0 (no record) or 1 (a single record).

Parameters:

  • comodel_name (str) – name of the target model Mandatory except for related or extended fields.

  • domain – an optional domain to set on candidate values on the client side (domain or a python expression that will be evaluated to provide domain)

  • context (dict) – an optional context to use on the client side when handling that field

  • ondelete (str) – what to do when the referred record is deleted; possible values are: 'set null', 'restrict', 'cascade'

  • auto_join (bool) – whether JOINs are generated upon search through that field (default: False)

  • delegate (bool) – set it to True to make fields of the target model accessible from the current model (corresponds to _inherits)

  • check_company (bool) – Mark the field to be verified in _check_company(). Add a default company domain depending on the field attributes.

definition

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

display_name

Basic string field, can be length-limited, usually displayed as a single-line string in clients.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – the maximum size of values stored for that field

  • trim (bool) – states whether the value is trimmed or not (by default, True). Note that the trim operation is applied only by the web client.

  • translate (bool or callable) – enable the translation of the field’s values; use translate=True to translate field values as a whole; translate may also be a callable such that translate(callback, value) translates value by using callback(term) to retrieve the translation of terms.

id

Special case for field ‘id’.
